title: Busabout to launch new offering
text:
Busabout to launch new offering Fri, 16 Oct 2015 2:36 PM Share Credit: pixabay.com/ flikaman 
Busabout is made by travellers for travellers, and their new 2016 offering is out of this world. With an entirely new Hop-On Hop-Off tour through Eastern Europe, including a snappy Ibiza Blast and a host of fantastic music festivals on offer you are sure to find a trip to fit your fabulously freestyle travel nature. 
If you want to party; they have festivals. If you want the best cities; they’ve got expert guides to show you around. And if you just want to make your way around Europe at your own pace, well, you’ve come to the right place to experience true freestyle travel. 
Busabout is flexible travel for free-spirited travellers who are 18 and older, and using their impressive network they link up must-see sights with off-beat adventures and allow travellers to choose how they want to do it. 
The new Eastern Loop Hop–On Hop-Off offers fourteen stops in total taking in Vienna, Bratislava, Olomouc, Krakow, Zakopane, Budapest, Zagreb, Split, Zadar, Venice, Tireste, Ljubljana, Bled and Graz. When you opt for this loop you’ll tick no less than eight amazing European countries off your must-see travel list. 
Visit the neo-Gothic Rathaus in Vienna and take in a dose of old-world charm mixed with Soviet era communist bloc styled buildings in gorgeous Bratislava. Then head on to the Czech Republic to visit Olomouc, a pre-touristy hidden gem of a town that is home to pubs, churches, castles and a university – ensuring really good beer at cheap prices. 
In Krakow you can visit the city made famous by the movie Schindler’s List as well as the Salt Mines, Auschwitz, the Old Town and Wawel Castle. While beautiful Budapest, the party capital of the East, awaits with her fabulous restaurants and legendary club scene. 
Speaking of clubs and music, Busabout has added a number of music festivals to their 2016 line-up. The Ultra Fest is only available on a Hop-on Hop-off and includes either 4 days camping or 5 days accommodation in a hostel. Sonar (Barcelona), BBK (Bilbao), Benicassim (Valencia) and Sziget (Budapest) can all be booked as stand-alone trips. 
Not to be outdone, Ibiza has come in with a short, sharp and snappy four day blast which can be added on to the original Ibiza Island Hopper or booked as a stand-alone trip. 
2016 promises to be stand-out year for free and easy flexible travel, and Busabout will take you to no less than 46 destinations in 14 countries throughout Europe. Book your 2016 Busabout trips now and take 20% off a Hop-On Hop-Off and 12% off any other Busabout, Haggis or Shamrocker trip. Simply pay a R1000 deposit with the balance due by 28 January 2016. 
For more information visit www.busabout.com or speak to the team on (011) 280 8440. Follow Busabout on social media using the #hopon hashtag – you’ll find them on Facebook and Twitter (@BusaboutSA). Press Release
